issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

comments.body:
Hi Team
I am getting this error on launching an instance of windows 2003 image.
it says, download attempt 1 will commence in 
download attempt 2 will commence in.
2013-08-05 13:40:52 DEBUG 000018284 statfs_path              | path '/var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work' resolved
2013-08-05 13:40:52 DEBUG 000018284 statfs_path              |   to '/var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work' with ID 0
2013-08-05 13:40:52 DEBUG 000018284 statfs_path              |   of size 241548681216 bytes with available 213485977600 bytes
2013-08-05 13:40:52 DEBUG 000018284 statfs_path              | path '/var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/cache' resolved
2013-08-05 13:40:52 DEBUG 000018284 statfs_path              |   to '/var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/cache' with ID 0
2013-08-05 13:40:52 DEBUG 000018284 statfs_path              |   of size 241548681216 bytes with available 213485965312 bytes
2013-08-05 13:40:53 DEBUG 000016647 doDescribeResource       | returning status=enabled cores=3/4 mem=3369/3625 disk=45/65 iqn=iqn.1994-05.com.redhat:5c9f6e5ddf9e
2013-08-05 13:40:53 DEBUG 000016647 doDescribeInstances      | invoked userId=eucalyptus correlationId=UNSET epoch=30 services[0]{.name=cc_01 .type=cluster .uris[0]=http://x.x.x.x:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC}
2013-08-05 13:40:53 DEBUG 000016647 doDescribeInstances      | [i-1CB1422B] Pending (not migrating) pub=10.117.91.200 vols=
2013-08-05 13:40:56 DEBUG 000018602 walrus_request_timeout   | wrote 0 byte(s) in 0 write(s)
2013-08-05 13:40:56 ERROR 000018602 walrus_request_timeout   | connection to Walrus failed: Operation too slow. Less than 360 bytes/sec transfered the last 10 seconds (28)

It appears like the walrus has not cache'd the image properly yet and hence the broker is not able to grab the image. This is getting some attention on the following bug https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/EUCA-6752

But on top of that I would like to highlight that you wont be able to run windows images as far as I know on ESXi in 3.3.0 version of eucalyptus due to the bug mentioned here https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/EUCA-7042 the target fix for this is shipping with Eucalyptus 3.3.1 later this month.


Hope this is useful information.
Thanks deependra. I am using this for test purpose only. I am using cloud in a box on single machine. version 3.3.0. Is there any workaround for this issue. ?.

for EUCA-6752 no there is no workaround yet we are still figuring out the fix. So it would come up little late trying for 3.3.1 

Regarding EUCA-7042 we have a hotfix but its only available for selected customers.
I would recommend you to talk to your sales representative who provided you with the vmware broker subscription
[~amankaushal], are you using the VMWare Broker (i.e. the host is VMWare vCenter or ESXi)?  If not you can run Windows instances on Linux/KVM

Hi Tim
I am using linux kvm. Now i tried by re creating image and reducing the size of windows 2003 image to 9.5 Gb but still the problem is there.

Please check.

Hi [~amankaushal]

Do you have a remote screen sharing software like teamviewer ? If so can you share your teamviewer partner ID and pass code with us so we can look at the problem and try to resolve it?

sure deependra. it's team viewer 8
id : 197363569
pass : 7162

Issue was resolved after uploading the image again and waiting for the walrus cache to get prepared. This did resulted in the 1st instance off that EMI to go to terminate but once the image was prepared the cache was good and we could start the 2nd instance just fine. When we left the session euca-describe-instances showed the instance as "running"

This was indeed what we see in EUCA-6752 , advise you to keep an eye on EUCA-6752 progress as thats the real issue here.

If you continue to face further issue just send us an email to support@eucalyptus.com or use our community forum.

Thank deependra. This solved the issue and got the instance in running state but i am not able to ping windows ip address.
Is there any way by which we can monitor what is going on in the instance ?
